docs.lead_paragraph: Students in New York City public high schools use condoms more consistently than teenagers across the country, and they are less likely to smoke marijuana and binge on alcohol, according to a new city-sponsored survey. But 25 percent of students in city high schools still engage in sexual behavior that puts them at risk for sexually transmitted diseases and pregnancy. And they say that experimentation with drinking or sex often starts before high school, at age 13 or younger.

headline.main: City Students Found Less LikelyTo Indulge in Risky Behaviors

docs.abstract: New York City reports that its high school students use condoms more consistently than teenagers across country and that they are less likely to smoke marijuana and binge on alcohol; says that 25 percent of students still engage in sexual behavior that puts them at risk for sexually transmitted diseases and pregnancy and that experimentation with sex and alcohol begins at age 13 and younger; smoking continues to decline, but one in three white girls in high school report smoking (M)
docs.snippet: Students in New York City public high schools use condoms more consistently than teenagers across the country, and they are less likely to smoke pot and binge drink.

docs.lead_paragraph: For years, Israel has feuded with the United Nations refugee agency for Palestinians over a wide range of issues, and recently Israel thought it had found a smoking gun to press its case. Based on a grainy videotape shot from a spy plane, Israel asserted that Palestinians in Gaza City had placed a rocket of the type being launched against Israel into a United Nations ambulance.

headline.main: Israel Feuds With Agency Set Up to Aid Palestinians

docs.abstract: Israel and United Nations Relief and Works Agency have had running battle; Israel claims agency's Palestinian workers help Palestinian militants, and that militants have often gained access to UN ambulances, schools and other facilities; agency's director Peter Hansen says Israel has frequently raised false or inflated accusations against it and has consistently hampered aid efforts by imposing stringent travel restrictions against its personnel in West Bank and Gaza Strip; since 2001, Israel has arrested and indicted 17 of agency's workers, accusing them of assisting militants; seven have been convicted by military courts; in incident in Gaza City in May, four Palestinian gunmen climbed into UN ambulance after placing wounded comrade inside; incident was captured by television cameraman, and Israeli military contends Palestinians used ambulance to escape; photo (M)
docs.snippet: The U.N. Relief and Works Agency is a symbol of the unresolved conflict that has left Palestinians in limbo for decades.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND WORKS AGENCY

docs.lead_paragraph: FOR 32 weeks, Elizabeth and Eric Hayes the parents of two sets of twins -- waited nervously. They marked the calendar with an X, a heart and a ''thank you'' for each day that passed uneventfully. Then, a few minutes after 1 a.m. on Wednesday, Sept. 14, in Long Branch, six new residents beat some very long odds. In a span of two minutes and 47 seconds, the 37-year-old Ms. Hayes gave birth to six babies -- born about six weeks early -- who are believed to be the state's first surviving sextuplets: Tara, Rachel, Rebecca, Ryan, Connor and Eric Jr.
docs.abstract: Article on Elizabeth and Eric Hayes, parents of two sets of twins and new parents of sextuplets, born on September 14, in Long Branch, NJ; last of six infants, who were born about six weeks early, has been brought home to Morganville; photos; drawing; chart (L)

docs.lead_paragraph: ALESSANDRA FERRI, under the cheerful guidance of the choreographer Christopher Wheeldon, is diving into an agonizing display of bent wrists, deep lunges and distorted signs of the cross. ''VIII,'' Mr. Wheeldon's new ballet, will have its American premiere on Friday at City Center, with Ms. Ferri dancing the role of Catherine of Aragon, Henry VIII's tragic, sonless first wife. ''It's all about Catholicism just festering away at this point,'' Mr. Wheeldon said as he plopped himself into a chair at the front of the rehearsal studio in Manhattan.
docs.abstract: Profile of and interview with 41-year-old ballerina Alessandra Ferri, who is celebrating her 20th year as principal dancer with American Ballet Theater; Ferri comments on physical regime she follows to keep her body strong and limber enough to dance; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Alessandra Ferri, who is celebrating her 20th year as a principal dancer with American Ballet Theater, talked about the purifying effects time can have on the body.

docs.lead_paragraph: SHAPIRO--Dr. Howard I. 66, a longtime resident of Westport, died suddenly of an apparent heart attack on October 13, while vacationing in Hawaii. In 1962, he was a founding partner of the Avery Center for Obstetrics and Gynecology. Recently, he retired from private practice and dedicated his time and skill as an obgyn at The Family Birthing Center at St. Vincent's Hospital in Bridgeport. Howard's dedicated and successful career gained him paramount respect as a leader in his field. Additionally, he was a recognized author who published numerous books related to women's health. Amongst his popular publications were ''The Birth Control Book'' and ''The Pregnancy Book for Today's Woman.'' He was a relentless advocate of a woman's right to choose. Howard's passion for his profession and his zest for life were unparalleled. He was a man of the utmost integrity and conviction. His intelligence, charm, and sincerity were a gift to all who were blessed to know him. He possessed a wonderfully unique sense of humor that brought light and laughter to all. Howard was a ranked tennis player who competed passionately on the USTA New England circuit. He was also an avid reader, fisherman, dog lover and master of vocabulary. In the spring of 1999, Howard was blessed to have found his love and inspiration, Maria. A warm, caring and devoted husband, father, grandfather, and friend, Howard leaves behind his wife Maria, his two daughters Suzanne and Marjorie, his granddaughter Madeline, and his stepchildren Lauren, Kristen and Matthew. Howard had a long and beautiful former marriage to the late Bette Shapiro. Services will be held Monday, October 18, 2004, at 1 PM, from The Abraham L. Green & Son Funeral Home, 88 Beach Rd, Fairfield, CT (www.greensfuneralhome.com). Dona tions: Dr. Howard Shapiro Education Fund, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology c/o St. Vincent Hospital, 2800 Main Street, Bridgeport, CT 06606.

docs.lead_paragraph: ''Palindromes,'' the latest film by Todd Solondz, is dedicated to the memory of Dawn Wiener, the unhappy young protagonist of his second feature, ''Welcome to the Dollhouse.'' The new movie, which begins at Dawn's funeral, is a sequel of sorts, following the appalling adventures of Dawn's 13-year-old cousin, Aviva, for whom the dead girl serves as both inspiration and cautionary tale. In the first of this movie's short chapters, each named for a character, Aviva, a secular Jew from the New Jersey suburbs, is portrayed by an African-American girl, one of eight actresses to play the role. As she makes her way, Candide-like, through a sordid world of sexual violence and cultural antagonism, Aviva's appearance changes -- from black to white, from fat to thin, from brunette to redhead, and at one point, to Jennifer Jason Leigh. The effect of this switching is to keep you off balance and at a remove from the story. That is not such a bad thing, because you will want to be as far away as possible.
docs.abstract: A O Scott reviews movie Palindromes, written and directed by Todd Solondz, part of New York Film Festival; photo (M)
docs.snippet: The real problem with "Palindromes," the latest film by Todd Solondz, is not that he goes too far, but that he seems to have no particular direction in mind.
